entries.speaker: Narrator
entries.text: The colors gradually desaturate. Shadows lengthen across the once-warm household.

entries.speaker: Ranima
entries.text: Get up, girl. There is work to be done. Now.

entries.speaker: Tejimola
entries.text: Please give me some food to eat, Ma...
entries.textAssamese: অনুগ্ৰহ কৰি মোক কিছু খাবলৈ দিয়ক, মা...

entries.speaker: Ranima
entries.text: Eat when the work is done. Now go to the dheki. There is rice to husk.

entries.speaker: Narrator
entries.text: Ranima watches every corner. Move carefully. If she catches you, there will be punishment.

entries.speaker: Narrator
entries.text: Hide behind furniture and cabinets. Crouch to move quietly. Avoid her gaze.

entries.speaker: Narrator
entries.text: The dheki awaits. A harsh, rhythmic labor. Match the beat to survive.

entries.speaker: Narrator
entries.text: Press Q and E in rhythm with the beat. The tempo will increase. As exhaustion grows, visions of the past may appear...

entries.speaker: Tejimola
entries.text: I see... Baba's boat on the river! The sun is shining...
entries.textAssamese: মই দেখিছোঁ... নদীত বাবাৰ নাও! সূৰ্যৰ পোহৰ পৰিছে...

entries.speaker: Narrator
entries.text: [The vision fades as the rhythm intensifies]

entries.speaker: Narrator
entries.text: Exhaustion takes hold. The rhythm fades. Tejimola collapses beside the dheki.

entries.speaker: Narrator
entries.text: The cruelty reaches its darkest moment. Beneath the nahor tree, a burial...

entries.speaker: Ranima
entries.text: No one will find her here. No one will know.

entries.speaker: Narrator
entries.text: But the earth remembers. The nahor tree drinks deep of sorrow... and begins to grow.

entries.speaker: Narrator
entries.text: Years pass. The house falls to ruin. The village whispers of a restless spirit...

entries.speaker: Ranima
entries.text: There you are! Hiding again? Lies! You never do as you're told!
